reviewText: Child of the late 80s and 90s reviewing here.  Maybe I am a product of my generation, I am not sure.  But, I enjoy reading and watching anything to do with ghost and the paranormal.  There were a lot of interesting shows on air when I was young that allowed people to wonder about and ultimately enjoy the paranormal...at least as entertainment.Unsolved Mysteries was a great program that ran for several years.  With an amazing host (Robert Stack!), eerie music, and great reenactments, you were sure to get creeped out with each episode!I own several other ghost and haunting DVDs and I consider this box set to be the best Ghosts DVD to date.  Unlike some DVD box sets, this set doesn't collect dust for very long before I'll watch a few discs late at night and feel like a kid again.Also:  Unsolved Mysteries is coming back on air on Spike TV, FALL 2008.  So, hopefully there will be another Unsolved Mysteries Ghost DVD set in the future.
summary: Ghost/Haunting Enthusiast?  Should already own this, then!

reviewText: An excellent series with many interesting stories. Unsolved Mysteries with Robert Stack.EpisodesDisk 1- Friendly Ghost, tells the story of the Grey manReserection Mary- A chicago ghostMatchmaker Ghost- tells the story of Mary GreenQueen Mary Ghosts- Ocean liner Queen Mary and the strange happenings on the shipGrace's Ghost- Ghost of a woman who was killed by a loverVoice from the Grave- ghost of a murder victimGhosts go to court- about a haunted houseThe Entity- a Texas Hills building thats hauntedGhost Boy- about a boy named MichealDisk 2- The black Hope Curse, about homes built over an old burial ground.Tallman's Ghost- house invaded by spirits, poltergeistGhost Blimp- a blimp in california whos passengers vanishedGordy's Ghost- neigbors who girl thought was ghostHighway Vision- a car accident and a vanishing motherCivil war ghosts- ghosts who have been spotted in civil war museumProfiling the Paranormal- about exorcismGhost Lights- Eerie strange lights that people have seen (which i have) that cant be explainedDisk 3- Lizzie Borden's House- a bed and breakfest , the house that Lizzie Borden lived in which they say is hauntedTatum's ghost- a old couple's house is hauntedGhostly Attraction- 109 year old mansion and a ghost that haunts it and was murderedGhost Writer- a man who dies returns to his daughter to write a letter to his wifeMary Celeste- a haunted Frigatte whos crew and captain had vanished.Comedy Store Ghosts- a haunted nightclubMyrtles Plantation- built on ancient indian buriel ground , a bed & breakfast.General Wayne's Inn- The general wayne inn in Pennsylvania, haunted inn.Devil's Backbone- acres of land haunted in texasDisk 4- Gettysburg Ghosts, The Gettsyburg Soldier's GhostsFrightened Family- house where young child diedMoss Beach Ghost- Moss Beach Distilery haunting, a restrauntLady In Black- man struck by lightning, lady came out of nowhere, saved his life and vanishedBullock's Deadwood- about a mining townLake Welles Haunting- haunted house , 19 yr old saw ghost in the bedroomMystery Hum- story about a loud persistant hum many people around the world hear, they cant find the source for it.Alway's Karen- story about a 21 yr old cancer victim, parents meet up with a minister and he communicates with thier dead daughter.Overall excellent collection of Stories, Highly Recomended, Enjoy.

A few stories were not present, but Ive noticed that most sets miss a few good stories. If they release a second collection of Ghosts, id be satisifed. Overall, a great buy if you love the show or just some great ghost stories.

reviewText: I always enjoyed this show as a kid and had an interest in anything that was Sci-Fi or paranormal, who doesn't like a good ghost story. There are many attention keeping storys here and some are cases  very well known. Some of the storys scared me as a kid and they are presented as scary, the Unsolved Mysteries music will send a chill down your spine before you even begin to watch the episode. The storys are not to long and you will get many to watch, some have been repeated and studied even today.  Robert stack is perfect as the narrator. The only reason I did not give it a Five star was not every story is a Ghost story but it is still interesting, if you missed this show while on TV I would pick it up but there should be no need to pay top dollar for the episodes.

reviewText: Being an paranormal investigator myself (when time allows) and someone who loves to read, watch and listen to nearly anything about ghostly phenomena, I had to give this DVD set a viewing (and add it to my collection of related videos).  I'm certainly glad I did.  It's been a long time since I've seen any of the episodes in this series, but I do remember they were very well done with excellent special effects depicting the spectral events.  I just wish there were more actual photos, videos and EVPs included in each show instead of mainly recreations.  Can't these people get some evidence of the real hauntings for the Unsolved Mysteries crew before they arrived to interview and document their cases?  Guess not.  It doesn't take a rocket scientist to put out a tape recorder with external microphone and get some EVPs (Electronic Voice Phenomena).  That's my speciality and I have hundreds of perfectly clear examples I've made myself from many locations.  BTW, I made an MP3 copy of the one from the "Queen Mary" episode and did to cleaning passes to get rid of white noise on it.  Came out great and the male spirit says, "Americans...Save my soul, kind sir.")  Setting up a video camera and just letting it run while the house/room/apartment/etc. is unoccupied is easy as well.  Play it back later and see if you got something.  Seems all the people in these videos are quite ignorant to simple techniques of capturing ghostly phenomena.  The stories are still excellent though.  But it drives me crazy to see the people involved in the events not caring for the disembodied spirits.  Take, for instance, the episode on disc one called "Grace's Ghost".  This woman needs resolution and it seems no one wants to help her out.  Someone needs to show her proof that the killer was brought to just many, many years ago so she can finally move on.  And the kid in the "Ghost Boy" story on disc one is also in need of help, but not from some clergy.  He needs someone to show him how to channel powerful, positive spiritual energies and aim them at the Dark Man.  If I can do it, that kid definitely has the potential due to his strong ESP ability to see spirits.  You can't just ignore a spirit, no matter where they are.  If they live with you, acknowledge their presence.  Talk to them, tell them off if they do something you don't like, explain the ground rules of living together, help them out if you can and if they are willing, etc.  Calling in a priest to do an exorcism is really dumb, because (1) it isn't going to work unless the spirit is a religious minded individual and (2) it doesn't clear anything up most of the time.  A non-religious poltergiest-like spirit is just going to stand out of the way and start up their annoying manifestations later.  Anyway, I've gotten off the topic.  The DVD set is a must have for any ghost fan's collection.  I just wish the credits, both on the disc cases and at the end of each DVD presentation would indicate when a particular episode came out.  Nowhere on or in the DVDs is there any indication to when a particular show was made.  Quite annoying, but not something that should keep you from owning this fine collection of shows.
summary: Love ghost stories?  Get this set!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wished there could be more quality documentaries like this - with great story-telling ability. First of all, Robert Stack is QUALITY personality and talent. John Cosgrove, one of the producers and writers of the Unsolved Mysteries series really knows what attracts the attention of the viewing public. These ghost stories are concise and suspenseful. They are lit very well and the camera work is exceptional. The only extras I would have loved to seen is more behind-the-scenes of what goes on when it comes to creating the lighting in these stories...I love the blue gel night scenes....Regardless of my film inquiries, this is one pack of dvds you won't be able to live without - especially during the halloween season. I wished there were more of these - and I wish Robert Stack was still alive to carry on the show - But John Cosgrove did the right thing - just like Jerry Seinfeld - go out on a win, and this is what they did. A+++++++++++++ all of the way!!

reviewText: Need some chills up your spine? I have to say this is the ultimate Ghost story collection I've ever seen and being an unsolved mystery  fan just makes this collection even more enticing. Started back in 1989, this collection from the series are the best of what the ghostly episodes had to offer until the year 2000. The scary narratives of Robert Stack with the amazing ghost stories will give you shivers up your spine. Make sure you watch at night to get full effect!  I could only come across a few stories that left me a bit bored, but the 25+ documentaries of well accounted ghostly events is great entertainment for anyone who has interest in the genre. Even better, be sure to check out the "Miracles" and fantastic "UFO" box sets for even more fun.

reviewText: I have a lot of documentary on DVD. From Cities of the Underworld to almost anything made by the History Channel I have a lot of DVDs about History, True Crimes and the Paranormal. After all these years and countless Hours spent in front of the TV I think my Unsolved Mysteries DVDs are still my favorites.I bought this set 4 years ago and I still enjoy watching some of the stories featured on this set: The investigation on the Queen Mary, "Ghost Lights", "Ghost Blimp", the investigation of Gettysburg, "Civil War Ghosts", "The Entity" and many others. This set is very fun to watch and even if I bought it 4 years ago I still can't get enough of it. There's something special about Unsolved Mysteries, a special atmosphere created by Robert Stack's voice and the theme song, there's a special "aura" around this show and this makes the DVDs even more enjoyable.I'm giving this set 4 stars instead of 5 simply because there is not enough actual investigations and way too many recreation by actors. But if you enjoy watching documentaries about the Paranormal then this set will be one of your favorites for a long, long time.

Title: N/A

reviewText: I love a good ghost story and unsolved mysteries, over the years, has given us tons of them.  34 episodes, 372 minutes plus bonus features, such as commentary for select episodes, means you can spend a whole day watching all the discs.  If you wanted to.The only reason I removed a point is that many of the ghost stories are just that.  They're stories without any real facts behind them.  For example, in the past few year the tales of murder and death on the Myrtles Plantation has come under attack.  There is, for example, no record of many of the events said to have happened there.  Many stories are based on urban legend and can't be proven one way or the other.Also, many of the stories rely solely on the events that happened to one person.  Alone, in the dark, by themselves.  Get the picture?  Sometimes when something goes bump in the night it IS just a cat.True, many episodes show scientists and engineers trying to solve the mysteries, which is cool, but also many of them have pet theories and ideas that help mold their investigations.  The idea, for example, that places have memories that we sometimes trigger, is one of them talked about in the commentaries.  That's interesting, but what if it's wrong?  Are they weighing the facts correctly or ignoring the evidence that points in a different direction?I do believe in ghosts.  But like alien life forms, which I also believe in, I don't think they visit us as much as we wished them to.  Do babies, before they are born, notice us?  Do they wonder what the noise is outside their tiny realms?  Are ghosts signs of what is beyond our Earth, signs of another stage in our life cycle or just trapped energy from a person's memory?Tons of fun for a good low price.

reviewText: THE SHORT: Some freaky stories taken from the show that did them best before X-Files. At 6 hours these are great sets but this one feels marred by too many boring "friendly ghost" tales.THE LONG: At present, I have three of these sets (the other two being "UFOs" and "Bizarre Murders"). Each is exactly as advertised and therefore a very nice collection, but it's my personal opinion that this one is the worst because it loses much of its creepy quotient due to the benevolence of many of the ghosts.There are 4 discs, an hour and a half each, so that's a lot of ghost tales and several are genuinely unnerving. I recall as a youth being afraid of a story of a poltergeist that rips a man's lunchbox from his hand and hurls it across the room, enflames his garage and tells him "you're dead". That one's on this set, and is an example of the more mean-spirited, "we're helpless in the face of this entity" stuff that make ghost stories interesting in the first place. It's just my opinion and others could care less, but I couldn't help feeling disappointed that at least half of this set is devoted to typical ghosts dressed in benign colonial garments or phantoms who are scary at first but whose subjects supposedly grow to accept and welcome the "mischievous" ghosts and their cute "pranks". I personally find that kind of tale a little boring and a lot less believable as a whole (these people just treat the ghosts as their friendly roommates? Come on). Those in search of more sensational stuff will get a fix in stories such as the ghosts in Lizzie Borden's house (complete with some freaky audio), or maybe a ghost who torments ranch guests by flat-out assaulting the walls all night, or "Resurrection Mary", a hitchhiker who appears and disappears near a cemetery. Unfortunately most of the stories on this set are less dramatic. Ghostly, yes, just not as impressive.In the long run, it's still a good set: I paid twenty bucks for a 6 hour collection of ghost stories, taken in their entirety from the Unsolved Mysteries show and peppered with commentaries here and there. You definitely get exactly what's advertised, which is appreciated. It's just a matter of taste that I preferred the more fantastic elements of this show, and got less of those stories than I would've liked - but a solid block of entertainment, nonetheless.
summary: Great value, but too many friendly ghosts.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm giving this DVD set a deserving 5 stars. The show was very well done and always entertaining. Who cares if there is no proof ghosts exist? Ghosts don't have DNA, they don't leave finger prints or foot prints. Of course it is one person or a family who's story is based on their own events. Sure, they could be lying but chances are they are telling the events as they believe them to be true. We all die and leave our mark. If you don't believe in ghosts you're a fool. That's another subject but had to voice it anyway. The only problem I have with this DVD set is that I would have rather they released it season by season. And the original theme song was replaced by the theme the show had during its Lifetime Run. Still, the show is so good I can't take away even a single star.
Title: N/A

reviewText: 11/09/09Upon reflection, and recently having watched these episodes again,a small criticism:"Calling Doctor Moe, calling Doctor Persinger, calling Doctor Roll...."If you catch my cynical drift.Like the overdependence of the A Haunting series on Connecticut's Warrens,Unsolveds go-to guys, Roll and Persinger quickly wear out their welcome asputative experts offering their pet theory explanations.Yes, obviously electromagnetism is a vital aspect of many if not most psychic phenomena.  However, the true skeptic must look askance at their self-promoting certainties.  The fact that the Unsolved producers overly depended on William Roll in particular remains an annoyance, particularly in retrospect, since new episodes will never be made nor will updates ever be provided.Should have mentioned this before. Luckily it's never too late to grind an old,dull axe!  Thank you, Amazon.*******************************************************************Perfect Halloween fare with the excellent Mr. Stackstrolling through a nicely laid out cemetaryof old legends and contemporary hauntings.Though many of these stories suffer somewhatfrom Unsolved's typical mini-documentary shallownessand brevity of content, the collection's overall qualityis exceptional.The synthesizer background music, lighting cinematographyand even most of the optical and computer effectsare tasteful and evocatively creepy.And because these stories are allegedly true,I think you will find they will get under your skin(like I know you are really hoping they will!)more deliciously than the Fangoria formulaic junkdecorating most video rental shelves.The only complaints I have is that this setdoes not include the Rainboy episode(which is instead found on the Psychics set,in my opinion an inappropriate choice), and thatthe producers' commentaries are, true to Unsolved form,nearly worthless ramblings that miss outon an opportunity to provide us withmore interesting background info.Otherwise, for those of you intelligently enthralledby the supernatural, as you dwell upon these storiesremember:Non omnis moriar...

reviewText: I am not going to recap the episodes since that has already been done by some other folks here.  I will just add "My 2 cents worth" instead.  This is a very good set of DVDs on ghosts and hauntings from the program "Unsolved Mysteries."  I always enjoyed this program when it aired on TV.  I have an avid interest in the paranormal and really enjoyed these stories which were "re-created" by actors and well done.  All of the stories BTW are based on true accounts of ghosts and hauntings. Some, like the Gettysburg Ghosts, The Gray Man of Pawley's Island, SC (who appears to warn of impending hurricanes), the ghosts of the Queen Mary, Resurrection Mary of Chicago and others may be more well-known but others were completely new to me such as the "haunted ranch" episode where the cowboys were hearing horrendous noises and footsteps at night and could not account for them. There were many others I had never heard of as well that were fascinating to watch. So basically to sum it up, if you are a fan of the show "Unsolved Mysteries" or just have an interest in ghosts, ghost stories, etc. then I really believe you will enjoy these DVDs.
summary: A VERY GOOD SET OF DVDS ON GHOSTS AND HAUNTINGS

reviewText: If you are fascinated by the idea that ghosts walk among us, you must have this 4-disc DVD collection. "Ghosts" is one of the better sets of Unsolved Mysteries that has been released on DVD, and it does not disappoint. Be sure to watch late at night with no other lights on for the full effect.Some of these tales are truly frightening, such as "Tallman's Ghost," "Tatum's Ghost," "Voice From the Grave," "Lake Wales Haunting," and one episode about a murdered man whose killer has never been captured returning to haunt his former mansion. Each episode is shown in its entirety, as they aired on NBC and CBS several years ago. The one episode that does not belong on this set, and I have no idea why it was included, is "Mystery Hum." The hum is in no way attributed to supernatural phenomena.This is an excellent DVD collection that I strongly recommend.
summary: Spooky and bone-chiling...what more could you want?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just bought this boxed set, and thought it was great. If anyone remembers this classic series, narrated by the unmistakable voice of Robert Stack, it'll take you back. As other members have stated, it's a collection, and is presented as such, showing just the ghost segment of any given show, complete with interviews and re-enactments.Is it creepy? Creepy, I suppose, is relative. I found it entertaining and fun. If you want a good ghost story that you can sit down and watch with the kids, or just by yourself, I would suggest buying this one. It was a great show, and deserved the DVD treatment.I also liked the tribute to Robert Stack.I thought adding that showed real class on the creator's part.If you are looking for more of the modern ghost hunting, and are an enthusiast looking to pick up hints on how to go about it, I would recommend also buying the Ghost Hunters Seasons One, Season 2 Part One, and Season 2 Part 2.Don't let the two Season Two DVDs throw you. They're very low priced, and combined, they cost about the same as a full season of any other show, so it's not a rip off.Hope this helped.So, go ahead, click the Add to Cart Button.Grab the family and sit down with some popcorn.And enjoy some good old family programming the way it used to be.
summary: Great Trip Down Memory Lane With A True Untouchable.
